instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2338: What is A2338? A2338 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2020 M1, Mid 2022 M2 with EMC 8162, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02020, 820-02773..
definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Hi,

I have the following problem. Macbook is not powering on at all. No sign of life.
The voltage from the adapter is stuck at 5V.

The voltage <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2_UPC</SIGNAL> on the USB-C Port Controller is missing, but the port doesn't have any short circuits nor does the board.
I see it's coming from PMU: Master LDO (<CHIP>U8100</CHIP>).
<SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON_MPMU_ISNS_VIN</SIGNAL> on it IS THERE, but <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2_UPC</SIGNAL> is NOT THERE.

Any idea what I can do? Is this the actual problem?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Any history available?

Other LDO present at <CHIP>U8100</CHIP>?
Change <CHIP>U8100</CHIP>...

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
No history. It just stopped powering on one day.

LDO 9-<SIGNAL>PP1V8_AON_MPMU</SIGNAL> is present - 1.8V.
VLDO 7-<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2_UPC</SIGNAL> is NOT present.
VLDO 3-<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S2</SIGNAL> is NOT present.

<SIGNAL>VDD_ANA</SIGNAL>-<SIGNAL>PP1V5_VLDOINT_MPMU</SIGNAL> is present 1.5V.

BUCK OUTPUTS on <CHIP>U8100</CHIP> are not present as well.

I don't think we have <CHIP>U8100</CHIP>, but if we find one and have to change it does it need programming or something?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
You must pick from other M1 donor board.
Not necessary exact same model.
